Articles.Content:
Famous last words (Frequency of times said)

2%: *Other*

3%: "Did I check the orientation of that decoupler? Pfft, I'm sure it'll be fine."

5%: "Quicksaving here wont screw me over will it? Nah, I'll Quicksave here, just to be safe"

10%: "Ok, I think the staging is fixed this time"

...

80%: "Lift off!"

"This looks alright!"

"We're fine!"

All too often when landing on Duna "main chute deploys in 3...2...1... SNAP ...AAAAAA... BANG !!!"

Edited December 28, 2013 by MBobrik

"Dammit, Mechjeb, when I clicked 'get closer' on the Rendezvous Planner, I meant like 20 meters on THIS side of the target, not the OTHER side of the target... or 20 millimeters at the braking burn... or..."
I'm going sideways only 20m off the ground I can still reach orbit.

"Welp, there goes the wing."

Moments before my plane flips the other way during launch crushing the capsule and killing poor Kengun.

"No space today...once again..." - decoupler upside down at orbit achievement stage

"This is baaad" - entire lower stage doing hurr-durr wibbly-wobbley , but I'm waiting untill actual destruction to activate abort sequence

"I'm sure I can physics warp this at 4x and it'll stay in one piece."

"I'm sure I can stop time warp in time to do the landing burn."

"I think it'll work this time. I remembered to fix everything that went wrong last time."
It 's going so well....

00:01: Liftoff!

00:15: Stop making the ship wobble, Jeb!

00:25: DO NOT DECOUPLE THAT SRB, MECHJEB! I'M NOT DONE WITH IT!

00:55: SRB separation in 3 seconds

00:58: SRBs separation, all is good.

01:27: Whoa easy there, NONONONO- *Ship explodes*

Every launch.

"Oh, I am supposed to enter orbit the OTHER way?"

On ascent from Ike, trying to dock with return craft. Tried to turn around. Misjudged gravity.

"Why is that engine/fuel tank/wing/srb moving faster than the rest of the rocket?"

"Parachute full deploy in 3...2...1... (unintelligible sounds as parachutes rip rocket apart)"

"Kill engines for landing in 3...2...1...0. Ah, beauti-why are you tipping? Stop tipping! *sob"

And the all time biggest cue for disaster and reason why I don't have many screenshots:

"I'm doing this mission for the forums. I'm going to take a bunch of screen shots and come up with a cool story."

"JUMP, JEB!"

And then...

Interesting.

Fascinating.

Oops.

Didn't kill them but those 3 fit what happened last night. I am starting to learn how to dock with a science lab and 3 man capsule which I am planning to use as a fuel depot for multiple landings on Mun or Minimus. Due to weight issues I launched with it's tanks empty and was transferring what was left in the assent stage while burning to get a stable orbit. Unfortunately I hit space instead of Alt so I ended up getting there by riding the last part of the assent stage while it was disconnected. Without fuel the launch was a loss and I reverted since I already have the lander up with lots of fuel in it's assent stage.

Famous last words of Bill Kerman during Mun landing:

"Wait, was I supposed to throttle up?"

Poor guy.
"Wow, aerocapture directly at laythe sure does produce some flames" *Craft bends into itself and snaps*

This is going well!

My plane for laythe's wings cause torque and rip the nuclear engines off, leaving me on a suborbital trajectory into the ocean (I recovered and landed at my base)

"Landing on Tylo couldn't be too hard."

"This wobble is totally normal."

"Those explosions during staging are harmless."

"Is it just me, or is the ground really getting closer?"

Quotations 2 and 4 are from my Tylo Mission, where I tried to conquer Tylo for Kermany with Hans Kerman. Didn't end well.

"Altitude of 6km? Nahh, I don't have to burn my engines for a few more seconds" - A few seconds later poor Bob slammed into the Mun. He died on impact and all future space craft were built with lights for night landings.

'wobble during launch is to be expected'

me teaching a mate how to play KSP, shortly before catastrophic launch vehicle failure
"Sepatrons working. Why arent we slowing down?"

"I'm pretty sure this rover is heavy enough for Minimus", I said moments before the rover went into a neverending roll across the surface. It was more suited to Eve I think.

"Wait.. I think the staging is all wrong here", just before my Munar orbital injection/braking stage separated and also ejected the command module. One of my most tragic fatalities resulted; Bill Kerman, a national hero for his first manned Mun and Duna landings. I have permadeath enabled too so he's gone for good.
"Yeah, I can put that into orbit. No sweat."

"WE NEED MOAR POWWWEEEEEERRRR-"

*crashes into mun*

That's why I only colonize minmus.

"WE NEED MOAR POWWWEEEEEERRRR-"

*crashes into mun*

That's why I only colonize minmus.

Have you tried more power?
